newsitem.title: USA: Lufthansa increases ex-JFK European flight.
newsitem.headline: Lufthansa increases ex-JFK European flight.

text.p: Lufthansa Cargo will operate 34 weekly Boeing 747 all freighter flights from the U.S. during its summer schedule, which runs from March 30 to October 25, it said today.

The carrier which transported over 156,000 tonnes of cargo from nine U.S. gateways in 1996, will be using its John F. Kennedy operations as a transit hub for flights originating in Atlanta, Dallas Ft.Worth and Miami. The move increases the carriers 747 freighter service at JFK from 10 to l7 weekly non-stop flights to Europe.
New York, its largest U.S. gateway, offers 12 scheduled 747 flights to Frankfurt and five to Cologne. Shipments arriving in Germany connect with any of its 450 cargo destinations in 93 countries.
The company said it flew approximately 1.7 million tonnes of cargo and mail worldwide in 1996, slightly higher from the previous year. - Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax +5017
